title: Spring Migration Bird Walk
description:
We're excited to kick off another year of our Nature and Cultural Outings Series. Spring migration is in full swing this month, and we're hosting a Spring Migration Walk through Brincka Cross Gardens led by JTNWI organizing director and avid birder, Lisa Vallee, with Kim Ehn, president of Dunes-Calumet Audubon. This free and family-friendly event offers a unique opportunity to observe various migratory birds, including warblers, thrushes, and sparrows. 

Our walk will explore key birding hotspots within the woods, offering tips on identification, birding by ear, and the importance of Indiana’s habitats for migratory species. 

Whether you're a first-timer or a seasoned birder, all are welcome! Binoculars and all outing supplies will be provided. Registration is required, and spots are limited, so please only register if you are sure to join!

title: NO KINGS Ventura

description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.


🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨


The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.


**On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.**

title: "How to Become a Leader in the Trump Resistance" - Planning Meetings
description:
The purpose of this weekly meeting is to design and execute a webinar series titled, "How to Become a Leader in the Trump Resistance."

MEETING SECURITY NOTE:

We are implementing measures to reduce disruptive Zoom attendees and require all attendees to 1) register with Zoom and 2) authenticate, which means that an attendee needs to be signed into their local device's Zoom application to join our meeting.

If you are still having trouble logging into the meeting despite having registered and having signed into your local device’s Zoom application, please follow these instructions - Step 1: Sign out of all Zoom accounts. Step 2: Close out of Zoom application. Step 3: Open Zoom application. Step 4: Sign into the Zoom account that is associated with the RSVP. Step 5: Go to your email. Step 6: Select the RSVP email and click the link. Step 7: Enter your information and click “join meeting now.”

If you cannot log in after following the above steps, please contact Zoom directly.

title: All Families, All Love– A collective Mutual Aid Campaign
description:
WHAT WE ARE COLLECTING:
-Tampons
-Menstrual pads
-Breastfeeding pads
-Breastmilk storage bags
-Postpartum recovery briefs
-Diapers (sizes 1-6)
-Pull-ups
-Wipes
-Baby soap
-Infant formula
-Baby bottles
-Baby food jars or pouches
-Teething crackers / Puffs

We're calling on our community to
help collect feminine hygiene
products and baby essentials that
will be distributed t o local families
in need.
The timing is no coincidence.
Mother's Day often celebrates the
ideal of motherhood, but behind
the flowers and cards are real
people who are stretched thin,
under-supported, and unseen. This
initiative is a way to honor
mothers by showing up for them
and families in solidarity and
support.
Let's make this Mother's Day about
more than sentiment. Let's make it
about care that's real, tangible,
and shared.

title: Congressional District TX-26 Town Hall
description:
​Let our GOP congressman know what we think about the chaos that his president and political party have brought to our country.

Join us from 6:30-8 pm on Tuesday, May 13, in the Robson Clubhouse to share your concerns about Social Security, Medicare/Medicaid, veterans' benefits, medical research, school funding, immigration...and so much more.

We invited Brandon Gill, our incumbent GOP congressman, to hear what his constituents have to say, but he wouldn't come.  Ernest Lineberger, who's running against him in 2026, will be there to listen to YOU.

We'll make sure that Brandon Gill does hear what you have to say:  we'll video record the event, post it to Facebook and send him a copy!

You don't have to live in Robson Ranch to speak out at our Town Hall.  All speakers limited to 90 seconds at the mic.  

Seating is limited, so you must sign up to attend at rrdemocraticclub.com/townhall25

title: RESIST and RECLAIM: Stop The Billionaire Takeover
description:
Our democracy is under attack. The current administration is making a full-blown power grab — shredding the rule of law, ignoring the courts, and handing over control of our country’s financial system to a billionaire crony. This is a hostile takeover, a coup, and we need relentless, united pressure to stop it.

We refuse to let our communities be ruled by greed, racism, and corruption. Here in Mahoning County, we draw the line. We demand justice. We demand a future that puts people before profit. We envision a future where healthcare is a right, not a privilege; where public education is for everyone; where billionaires don’t get to rewrite the rules to favor themselves and enslave the workers. 

This is more than a protest – this is a movement to reclaim our power, restore our rights, and fight for a future where everyone is treated with dignity and respect.


Where: Mahoning County Courthouse, 120 Market Street, Youngstown Ohio 44503

When 3:00PM-6:00PM

Sign up now and bring a friend!

How to Prepare for Your Event:

- Bring chairs and your outside voices!
- Brinq signs or props → Make your message visible!

(Ideas: "PROTECT OUR CONSTITUTION," "NO KINGS", "PROTECT OUR MEDICAID", “STOP THE COUP", "NO TAX BREAKS FOR
BILLIONAIRES")

Recruit friends → The more people, the more power.

Record everything → Post photos/videos and tag us @MahoningValleyFreedomFighters #MVFF

Contact Us: Indivisiblefreedomfighters@gmail.com

title: Reimagine Resistance
description: At Reimagine Resistance, we come together with music, speakers, conversation, creativity, and community connection to express, learn, share, and act. Our theme for May 11, Mother's Day, is "Arise, then...women of this day!" We'll gather at Brix Cider, 6:00-7:30 PM in a grassroots gathering, coming together in heart, mind, and body in response to the political, social, and environmental crises of our time.True resistance rises not only in protest but in the weaving of bold action, gathered community, unflinching truth, wild creativity, and tender care. It is a living tapestry, crafted in defiance of the violence, greed, and cruelty that haunt our world, and stitched with the belief that a more just and compassionate future is always possible. You are welcome to attend this free and open event, sponsored by Brix Cider, PFLAG Mount Horeb Area, Mount Horeb Progressive Trolls, and Southwest Wisconsin Area Progressives (SWWAP).

title: Conversations That Move
description:
Join the Portage County Democratic Party for Conversations That Move: Using Motivational Interviewing to Strengthen Democratic Participation! 

Navigating political conversations in a polarized climate requires empathy, thrust, and openness. Motivational Interviewing (MI), a technique rooted in counseling, can be adapted to community settings to support respectful, productive dialogue. 

By listening actively, asking open-ended questions, and reflecting with empathy, MI helps individuals explore their views and move toward common ground through mutual understanding - not persuasions.

title: We the People are NOT the Waste!
description:
This a local Indivisible event! The South Siskiyou Resistance Coalition is sponsoring a Rally and March in Mt Shasta.

The cuts to spending on federal people-programs like Veterans, Schools, Seniors, Libraries, and now NPR & PBS are so deep, we are all going to bleed.  

Come be part of the sea-change that we want to see.  Rally with us. March with us.  Stand up and Fight back!

We'll gather in Parker Plaza at 11:30. Those who want to march will be led on a short route through town and back to Parker Plaza, where we'll have a rally with speeches, protest songs, and chants.

Please bring instruments, drums, signs, cow bells, and your vocal spirit.  

All are welcome and wanted here! 

As always, this is a non-violent event. If we see counter protestors, we ignore, or applaud and cheer them on.
accessibility_notes: Parker Plaza has many places to sit, on benches and planters.  Those who do not want to participate in the march through town will hold down the fort in Parker Plaza, continuing the rally.

title: Stronger Together Tour – Virtual Event with N'Kiyla Thomas
description:
Join U.S. Senate candidate N'Kiyla “Jasmine” Thomas for the kickoff of her Stronger Together Tour, a powerful virtual event series focused on uniting Oklahomans through open dialogue, shared values, and bold vision for change.

In this first virtual stop, Jasmine will share her personal journey as a nurse, autism mom, Army wife, and Chickasaw citizen—and how these life experiences shape her platform focused on education reform, healthcare accessibility, tribal sovereignty, LGBTQ+ rights, and support for families impacted by domestic violence.

This interactive session will feature:
✅ A live address from Jasmine Thomas
✅ Policy overviews with real solutions for Oklahoma
✅ A Q&A segment with audience participation
✅ Ways to get involved in the campaign

Whether you're a long-time supporter or just learning about Jasmine’s campaign, this is your chance to hear directly from the candidate, ask questions, and become part of a growing movement for progress, equity, and unity in Oklahoma.

Let’s build a stronger Oklahoma—together.

title: Defending Democracy: Woman's Rights
description:
Join us for our 10th consecutive rally to Defend Democracy in beautiful downtown Bethel.  While our overall theme is Defending Democracy, each week we pick a specific focus.  On Saturday May 10th 11am -12:30pm, our focus will be Woman's Rights.

The rally is non-partisian.  All are welcome.  We'll have speakers address the attack on Woman's Rights by threats to DEI, Voting rights and Healthcare.
Guest speakers include a local ACLU lawyer involved in the reproductive rights movement and a local community member who would like to share their story and experience on why women’s healthcare needs to be equally accessible for everyone in this country.  Our live music will be provided by Sweet Polly Duo, a great duo from Clinton, CT.  They are an energetic pairing of vocals by Pat Anwari and guitar by Rocky Ridge.

There will be something for everyone.  We'll have speakers, we'll rally with our signs, we'll take a short march and we'll have live music.  We also like to end each week with a sing-a-long.

A sign-making table will also be available,  complete with all the necessary supplies,  for young and old to make signs for the rally.

We also collect a non-perishable food item for our local food pantry each week.

title: Pro-Democracy Taking Back the Flag--June 14th
description:
How cool would it be if we had over 1000 flags on the bridge? Either wave a flag or put a flag on your poster. Let's take our flag back!!

On June 14—Flag Day—Donald Trump wants tanks in the street and a made-for-TV display of dominance for his birthday. A spectacle meant to look like strength. But real power isn’t staged in Washington. It rises up everywhere else.

No Kings is a nationwide day of defiance. From city blocks to small towns, from courthouse steps to community parks, we’re taking action to reject authoritarianism—and show the world what democracy really looks like.

We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.

description:
# Join Us May 17!

Stop the attacks on our students, educators, and communities! On Saturday, May 17, we will raise our voices against attacks launched by the Trump administration.

## We're Fighting Back!

We won’t stand by while the attacks from the Trump administration threaten resources for our students. Our union has the power to demand that Congress protect funding for students and the Department of Education programs we all rely on, and to keep our school spaces safe from ICE Raids.

On Saturday, May 17, join educators and allies at Fight for Schools rallies across our state to stand up for students and defend public education!

## How We Are Fighting Back

Our Union is Organizing Mass Rallies on May 17

We launched an initiative with members, local chapter leaders, and both CTA and NEA Board of Directors and organized delegations to the 9 GOP Congressional member offices in California from April 11 to April 27, when representatives were in their districts. We urged members of Congress to commit to protecting funding for students and the Department of Education programs we all rely on, and to keep our school spaces safe for all students!

Additionally, we’ll be organizing with local chapters in Sacramento, San Francisco, Hanford, Los Angeles, and San Diego for rallies on May 17. Mark your calendars and SAVE THE DATE!

title: Indivisible Westside: Hands Across Chicagoland
description:
Hey Indivisible Westside and Friends! 

Join tens of thousands of your fellow Chicago-area citizens as we form a human chain of conscience across Chicagoland in peaceful protest against Trump’s illegal and authoritarian actions and the GOP's failure to defend the Constitution.

Bring signs, wear black, and make some noise.

We will line sidewalks along 30 miles from Aurora to Chicago along Ogden Ave, 26th Street and California Ave to Douglass Park. This is a peaceful protest. We will not block streets or businesses along the route.

Please go to www.handsacrosschi.com and enter your zip code to get an assigned location along the route (No need to RSVP - use the "Find Your Spot" button). This is important so that we can spread people out evenly along the route, while keeping people closer to where they live. Our assigned geographical area is roughly the stretch of Ogden from 1st Ave to Cicero based on our zip codes for Indivisible Westside.

{{Ignore the map below; that is not your assigned location}}

President Trump has defied court orders and forcibly sent people to a torture dungeon in El Salvador without a hearing or due process. Now he claims he’s unable to bring them back. He's ignored court rulings and arrested judges. If he can do this to them, he can do it to anyone.

These are the actions of a dictator—not a democratically elected president. Silence is not an option. When leaders cross the line into authoritarianism, it’s up to us—the people—to push back. This protest is about more than politics. It's about defending basic human dignity, civil liberties, and the idea that no one is above the law.

Bring your family, friends, neighbors, coworkers—anyone who believes in freedom and democracy.

Confirmed Sponsors: Democratic Party of DuPage County, Democratic Women of DuPage County (DWDC), Illinois Democratic Women, Illinois Federation of Teachers, IL Veterans for Change, Indivisible Batavia Aurora Area, Indivisible DuPage, Indivisible Evanston, Indivisible Illinois, Indivisible Naperville, Indivisible Skokie Morton Grove Lincolnwood, Indivisible Westside, Indivisible West Suburban Chicago, Lisle Township Democratic Organization, Milton Township Democratic Organization, Naperville Township Democratic Organization, Operation Swing State, Personal PAC, Progressives for Change (Elmhurst), West Suburban Teachers Union Local 571, We Can Lead Change (Fox Valley), Winfield Township Democratic Organization, York Township Democratic Organization

title: From PGH to Harrisburg: Lets Win Transit for All PA! (PPT Monthly Meeting)
description:
## Our local transit service needs state funding, and riders are organizing to win it!! // May 13, 6:30pm - Social Time, 7-8:30pm Meeting // Spanish language and ASL interpretation will be available

Español debajo

Whether we're Black or White, rich or poor, Pittsburghers need an expanded transit system we can rely on. However, state funding shortfalls have forced our agency to promise drastic cuts that would decimate our city. The good news is that riders are fighting back. Just last week, hundreds of PGH transit supporters rallied for expanded service. We've released a policy roadmap that can expand our service and some of our legislators are putting these ideas into action. The time is now to keep the pressure on and we need you in this fight!

All are welcome to join PPT for our Monthly General Meeting. We use our meeting each month to give updates on current campaigns, discuss strategy and tactics, train on new skills and build community. This month's meeting will be on Zoom. Feel free to join this virtual meeting, 6:30pm Social time // 7:00-8:30pm Meeting.

--------------

## ¡Nuestro servicio de transporte local necesita financiación estatal! // 13 de mayo // 6:30 p. m. - Hora de convivencia // 7-8:30 p. m. - Reunión // Habrá interpretación en español y ASL disponible.

Seamos negros o blancos, ricos o pobres, los habitantes de Pittsburgh necesitamos un sistema de transporte público ampliado en el que podamos confiar. Sin embargo, la escasez de fondos estatales ha obligado a nuestra agencia a prometer recortes drásticos que devastarían nuestra ciudad. La buena noticia es que los usuarios están contraatacando. La semana pasada, cientos de partidarios del transporte público de PGH se manifestaron para ampliar el servicio. Hemos publicado una hoja de ruta de políticas que puede ampliar nuestro servicio y algunos de nuestros legisladores están poniendo estas ideas en práctica. ¡Es hora de mantener la presión y los necesitamos en esta lucha!

Todos son bienvenidos a unirse a PPT para nuestra Asamblea General Mensual. Usamos nuestra reunión cada mes para brindar actualizaciones sobre las campañas actuales, discutir estrategias y tácticas, capacitarnos en nuevas habilidades y construir una comunidad. La reunión de este mes será por Zoom. No dude en unirse a esta reunión virtual, 6:30 p. m. Hora social // 7:00-8:30 p. m. Reunión.

title: Protect NY's Climate Law - Syracuse
description:
Join Citizen Action of NY, PUSH Buffalo, NY Renews, Third Act Upstate New York, and local CNY groups to rally and testify at a DEC public hearing in Syracuse on June 3 at noon to defend NY’s Climate Law.

New Yorkers will join to voice their support for climate leadership and to urge Governor Hochul to stand up to Trump by funding climate legislation. Join us and help make this impactful by emailing egormley@citizenactionny.org.

The climate change-denier in the White House is doing everything he can to eliminate climate progress in this country. We need climate leadership in NY, and we need it now. Unfortunately, in January, Governor Hochul revealed that she’s delaying a crucial component of the state’s Climate Law called Cap and Invest. 


Cap and Invest is an emissions-reduction program that would limit, or cap, emissions from major polluters in the state. That cap would tighten over time, gradually reducing the amount of emissions allowed for release. Meanwhile, major polluters will have to pay to release polluting emissions up to the level of the cap. Those funds from polluters will then be used to invest in green energy, jobs, home decarbonization programs, and similar efforts to support NY communities.

To move Cap and Invest forward, we need the Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) to release three sets of regulations that hold polluters accountable to Cap and Invest. Unfortunately, Governor Hochul has  released only one.

title: Braintree Democratic Caucus
description:
Registered and pre-registered Democrats from Braintree are invited to attend the Braintree Democratic Caucus. All registered and pre-registered Braintree Democrats are eligible to vote in the caucus and to run for election as a delegate to the 2025 MassDems State Convention.

To be eligible, pre-registered Democrats must be at least 16 years old by March 29, 2025, and must be pre-registered at the time of the Braintree Caucus.

*Caucus registration will open at 6:30 PM and close at 7:15 PM.
*You must be present in person or online at the caucus and signed in by 7:15 to vote.

If you are unable to attend in person, you may participate remotely by registering at bit.ly/BraintreeCaucusMay2025.

The 2025 Massachusetts Democratic Party State Convention will be held on September 13th, 2025, at the MassMutual Center, 1277 Main Street, Springfield, MA. This year's convention will be a Platform Convention, where Democrats from across the state will meet to vote on what the priorities of the party will be for the next four years.

Braintree is allotted 19 delegates and 4 alternates to the Convention.  Learn more at https://www.massdems.org/caucus-and-convention.

title: It's Time For a Just Peace: Solidarity Event
description:
It’s Time is an unprecedented coalition of 60 Israeli peace and civil society organizations, uniting Jewish and Palestinian leaders, members, and partners, that are working together to end the Israeli-Palestinian conflict through a political agreement that ensures the rights of both peoples to self determination, equality, and free and secure futures. 

They have called for global community events on May 8 in solidarity, to raise people's awareness of this movement, and for igniting political imagination and fostering actionable engagement. 

We are holding one in Tucson at Homeward Books at 6:30 PM this Thursday May 8!  Come to meet others in support of a just peace and learn more about this under-covered movement!
accessibility_notes: I'm not sure how wide the doorways are but there is definitely a front courtyard that is 100% accessible we could use in a pinch.  I think it should be fine, I didn't measure or check the bathroom.

title: French Broad River Clean-Up - Pisgah Forest River Access to Penrose Boating Access Area 5/31
description:
Volunteers are invited to help clean up trash with French Broad Paddle Trail Manager, Jack Henderson, and other members of MountainTrue's French Broad Riverkeeper team. 

The clean-up will be boat-based and focus on the French Broad River in Transylvania County between Pisgah Forest River Access and Penrose Boating Access Area.

MountainTrue can provide canoes (with paddles and PFDs) to volunteers with previous paddling experience, but attendees are otherwise requested to bring their own boats. MountainTrue will also provide gloves, trash bags, a dumpster for trash removal, and a shuttle to the put-in at Pisgah Forest River Access.

We have a limited number of MountainTrue boats. Please copy/paste this link to request to borrow a MountainTrue boat: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfYg1-6cQai4J3_wlejW3AgK-evQMkj4mkUXxNYmUBGPD1G2g/viewform?usp=sharing

**ALL participants, regardless of whether you are borrowing a boat, must register for the event to ensure we can adhere to safety standards for the number of participants.

Please bring:

- PFD if bringing your own boat.
- Appropriate clothing and footwear for paddling and cleaning up trash (closed-toed shoes recommended). 
- Drinking water, snacks, lunch.
- Change of clothes for after the event.

Kids under the age of 18 are allowed as long as accompanied by a parent/guardian AND are experienced paddlers.

title: NO KINGS [City name]
description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.


🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨


The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.


**On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.**
Check out nokings.org for more information.

*A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.*

title: Roswell Empowered Alive After 5 Sidewalk Protest
description:
We had our first successful rally in Roswell on 5/3–let’s keep up the momentum. Empower Roswell, Ignite Change. This is only the spark!

Roswell may be a small city just outside of Atlanta, but our voices are big. Our voices matter.

It’s important for our leaders—both local and state-wide—to know and understand that people all across this country, this state, this city—the city of Roswell—are not going to accept the reckless agenda of the current administration.

Regardless of political affiliation, we all know that deep down what has been happening is not ok. And we want our leaders—regardless of political affiliation to hold this administration accountable.

We want leaders who will fight for the futures of our families, not those concerned only about their fortunes.

We want leaders who will stand up and fight for our schools and ensure our children have access to quality education, not those who want to erase history and rip away programs designed to help students that need it the most. We want leaders who will protect our neighbors, not those who spread fear and hateful rhetoric and seek to eliminate diversity in our communities.

We want leaders who will fight for our rights, fight for democracy, not those who promote corruption, oligarchy and tyranny.

We want leaders who will protect healthcare including Medicare, Medicaid, and affordable treatment and prescriptions, not those who seek to pull the rug out from the most vulnerable members of our communities—veterans, the elderly, those will special needs, the sick, the impoverished.
We want leaders who lead by example, not those who sell their own Bible, but exemplify the opposite of its contents.

We want our leaders—local and nationwide—to hear us and take action against Trump and his corrupt billionaire buddies. And that action starts here, in Roswell, GA.

A peaceful sidewalk protest on both sides of Atlanta St between Magnolia and Norcross Streets—parallel to the Alive After 5 event on Canton St.

Please remain on the sidewalk, no signs that say “honk”, follow all local laws.

This event will be rain or shine.
Parking gets tight—please make a plan to carpool, park in one of the local churches, or find paid parking (I know that’s not ideal, but make sure if you do park in a paid lot you pay—typically by phone—we don’t want anyone getting towed).

Thank you for your support and look forward to seeing you there!
Roswell Empowered: Empower Roswell, Ignite Change

You will need access to a smartphone, computer or tablet and wifi. 

Together, we can put our values into action, one conversation at a time.

title: NJ: Make Calls to Elect Climate Champions this June!
description:
Food & Water Action is proud to endorse [an exciting slate of candidates](https://www.foodandwateraction.org/endorsements/) in the upcoming New Jersey legislative primaries on June 10 — and now it's time to get them to Trenton!

**Join us to call voters and get our endorsed climate champions elected to the New Jersey legislature!**

New Jersey is holding its first competitive legislative primaries in decades, following the abolition of the "county line," a tool that's been used by the county parties for years to sideline viable challengers. This year, we have fair ballots and some great candidates running as climate champions from across the state!

With the primary election fast-approaching, we need your help to elect a new cohort of climate champions to the New Jersey legislature. Sign up here to join one of our call shifts!

title: Stand Up / Speak Out Rally in Hudson
description:
Stand Up/Speak Out is holding a rally in Hudson on May 25 in response to the ongoing cuts to the federal workforce and services that support veterans, Social Security beneficiaries, and healthcare providers and patients in New York. The event hopes to encourage local citizens to gather, learn from one another, and sound the alarm that no one is safe in an America that has turned its back on its veterans, the elderly, and the ability of millions to access healthcare. 

Our speaker lineup so far includes Andrea Goldstein, a veteran and a former staffer of the House Committee on Veterans Affairs; Rennie Glasgow, Vice President of the American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE ), Local 3343; and Ashley Fox, MA, PhD, a public policy and global health policy expert. In addition, we will hear from folks directly impacted by the current and anticipated federal cuts to the Veterans Administration, Social Security, and government healthcare programs, including Medicaid.

Come join in! Bring your signs and your friends!

title: GrowthX Masterclass: Stop Chasing Leads, and Start Closing Deals
description:
If "sales" makes you cringe, you’re not alone. But here’s the thing: if you’re a founder, you’re in sales. This workshop will show you how to approach GTM in a way that feels natural, builds momentum, and actually works—no tactics required.We’ll cut through the noise and focus on real, actionable strategies to:

- Identify and target the right customers (without wasting time on the wrong ones)

- Build a repeatable, scalable sales process that grows with your business

- Close deals faster by focusing on what actually moves the needle

- Avoid common GTM pitfalls that leave too many startups stuck in limbo

GrowthX helps B2B founders get to market and grow revenue. That’s how we identify investment opportunities.

title: United in Prayer for a Compassionate Budget
description:

We rally for funding MEDICAID, HEAD START and CHILD CARE and safety net services.

Through expressions of our faith, we will share messages about why we need a compassional budget through Song, Prayer, Dance and The Spoken Word. 

There will be a combined state choir to lead rally goers in well known congregational songs. We encourage those who are interested in participating in the combined state choir to click the box to join the choir on this registration form.  

FOOD AND T-SHIRTS will be provided to those who sign-up.

title: Weekly ICE Protest
description:
Every Wednesday @ Noon outside ICE office on Poydras.
Gather with signs and voices.  We're growing each week!

No need to sign up, just show up!


First few minutes we take turns on the mic to share info, then we stand along the curb with our signs for visibility and to grow public support for due process.  End around 1pm.  Don't block the sidewalk.
accessibility_notes: Outdoors, so bring sunblock and water, normal accessibility of a public sidewalk, unfortunately no seating.

Musk has said he will work one or two days per week for DOGE.  Not good enough!  We want him fired! 

📍 Where: Ann Arbor Tesla Dealer, 3530 Jackson Rd, MI  48103

✅ Bring signs or props → Make your message visible! (Ideas: “MUSK OR US,” “NO KINGS”, “PROTECT OUR MEDICAID”, “NO TAX BREAKS FOR BILLIONAIRES”). We have big banners.

title: Spring Open House & Volunteer Celebration
description:

Together we will tour the garden, learn about compost, and get our hands dirty with crafting and gardening! Indulge in free crafting activities, light bites, and refreshing beverages while connecting with EVCG gardeners, LA Compost staff, Frogtown Arts, fellow volunteers, and community members. Let’s celebrate the spring season together! 🌿 

### FREE ACTIVITIES: 
* Patchwork mending: Come bring an item in need of patching! We’ll have sewing machines and free patches (*one clothing item per person) 
* Rock Painting: Help us beautify our remediation area by painting a new addition to the rock wall 
* Compost Sifting: LA Compost staff will be leading demos about the compost process and how to get involved with volunteering! 
* Garden Tours: Come meet the EVCG gardeners and learn about how you can join the gardening community. 
* Flower arrangement making: We’ll have free flowers and ribbons for you to make your very own bundle to take home. 

Admission is FREE, but please register to ensure we have enough refreshments and materials for all guests.

title: Activism 101: Organized by Northern Lights Indivisble
description:
Northern Lights Indivisible is hosting an Activism 101 Conference this Saturday from 9am to 4pm. It will be at the TreeHaven, University of Wisconsin, Stevens Point located in Tomahawk, Wisconsin.

Whether you're an experienced activist or just a fledgling- this conference is just for you! Meet with 100 like-minded individuals to shre stratgeies and ideas. Learn from seasoned pros.

Three break-out sessions:

Civil Discourse
Effective Poster Making
Dismantling Disinformation

Plenty of time for networking an team building. 

Cost for the entire day, with lunch is $35.00
Payments to: Northernlightsindivisible@gmail.com via Paypal.

title: Phone Banking for Sam
description:

title: Volunteer to staff the LCDP table at the Poultry Festival
description:
We have volunteer spots open to staff our table at the Batesburg-Leesville Poultry Festival on Saturday, May. 10.

We will be in space 4 between the Railroad tracks and Highway 1, close to the entertainment area.

We have 2-hour shifts available from 10am-12pm, 12pm-2pm and 2pm-4pm.  Volunteer spaces are limited, so please only sign up if you are able to commit.

title: Austin Rally - Fight for Your Rights

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
AT A GLANCE:

Our first #FightForYourRights action hits the streets of Austin to confront the full slate of Governor Greg Abbott’s power-grabs - from erasing a majority-Black district’s voice in Congress to criminalizing life-saving abortion care for women and persecuting the doctors and parents of trans kids.

Teachers, nurses, immigrants, veterans, parents, faith leaders and working families are uniting behind a simple demand: end Governor Abbott’s politics of cruelty and control and restore the rights and freedoms of all Texans.


WHY THIS FIGHT?

Here's what Greg Abbott has been up to lately:

★ Silencing voters by delaying the special election for Texas's 18th Congressional District, leaving 800,000 Texans without representation.

★ Criminalizing trans youth and their families by banning affirming care, threatening & suing doctors who provide care, attacking parental rights.

★ Pushing abortion bans with bounty-hunter enforcement and endangering women's lives.

★ Militarizing the border and putting women & children in danger.

★ Hollowing out our schools with curriculum gag orders and persecution of teachers.


Abbott doesn't care about defending your rights. He cares about controlling you instead.

title: NO KINGS Colebrook
description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.


🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨


The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

Keep your poster message positive ~ we want publishable photos & videos of our rally for the media.

Keep it peaceful!  We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. 

Keep together - We want to be visible and vocal, but it's important that we not block pedestrians, doorways, etc.

Let's not give anyone a reason to shut down our rallies.

Here is a link to Move-On’s video on de-escalation & calming strategies:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R2PSExM-NhU&t=5s

Here is a link to the American Civil Liberties Union’s “Know Your Rights - Protestors”:  https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/protesters-rights#im-organizing-a-protest

Parking:  There is a free lot on the west side of Rt. 3
